error.signature: Error: Route used `searchParams.X`. `searchParams` should be awaited before using its properties.
error.regex: searchParams.+should be awaited before using its properties

verdict.summary: Next.js 15 changed searchParams and params from synchronous objects to Promises. Code that accesses searchParams.X directly without awaiting will fail. This is a breaking change from Next.js 14.

dead_ends.action: Downgrade to Next.js 14 to avoid the breaking change
dead_ends.why_fails: Downgrading avoids the immediate error but locks the project out of Next.js 15 features and security updates. The migration is straightforward and should be done instead.

dead_ends.action: Type searchParams as a plain object (e.g., { X: string }) without Promise
dead_ends.why_fails: TypeScript types may suppress editor errors, but at runtime searchParams is still a Promise. Accessing properties without await returns undefined or throws.

dead_ends.action: Use useSearchParams() hook in a Server Component to get synchronous access
dead_ends.why_fails: useSearchParams() is a Client Component hook and cannot be used in Server Components. In Server Components, the only way to access search params is through the page/layout props which are now Promises.

workarounds.action: Await searchParams before accessing its properties in Server Components
Use React.use() to unwrap the searchParams promise in Client Components
workarounds.condition: Component is a Client Component and cannot use async/await

workarounds.action: Use the next/headers cookies() and headers() with await as well during migration
workarounds.condition: Multiple async request APIs need to be accessed together

leads_to.condition: Developer makes a Client Component async to await searchParams

preceded_by.condition: Upgrading from Next.js 14 to 15 where searchParams was accessed synchronously

frequently_confused_with.distinction: cannot-read-properties-searchparams is about searchParams being undefined/null at runtime; searchparams-sync-access is specifically about the Next.js 15 async API migration
